column4: can anyone help me?  is there a good app that can download videos from YouTube?
the unplug extension for firefox
are you sure the kernel upgrade finished?
i thought it did
sudo dpkg --configure -a to make sure the package finished configuring
its also possible that you went from like -3.20 to -3.21 which doesnt make a new entry in the menu. only going to -4 would do that
it says my system is up to date
then it was probably an upgrade that *doesn't* require a new menu.lst entry
your kernel's naming format is something like 2.6.27-3.20 (for example). if the 27 or the 3 changes, you get a new entry. if the 20 changes, you don't.
but when i do "uname -r" i get "2.6.24-22-generic"
right, because only the 24 and 22 really matter for the ABI
the package should, i think say the . bit, but it doesnt change the ABI, so proprietary drivers (like fglrx for ati cards) dont need to be reinstalled
the . bit is just which time it was compiled. it means it was just a small change.
so is there any way to boot into a kernel designed for 8.10 instead of still using the 8.04 kernels i have?
you can install one
how would i go about that

packages.ubuntu.com, find the 2.6.27-x-generic where x is the highest number. install that one. but if youve got binary ati or fglrx, you'll have a problem. because then you need the newer graphical drivers, and then you need a newer X and then you need to upgrade all your graphical apps...
at least, its possible to get into that mess if you need binary drivers
can you link me the site for the kernel download?
http://packages.ubuntu.com/intrepid/linux-image-2.6.27-9-generic
thank you
